Question: What is the only fruit that has its seeds on the outside?
Interesting Fact: Each tiny yellow dot on a strawberry is actually an individual fruit with its seed.

Question: Who was the first person to walk on the moon?
Interesting Fact: Over six hundred million people watched the televised moon landing live in nineteen-sixty-nine.

Question: Which animal is known as the "King of the Jungle"?
Interesting Fact: Lions actually live in grasslands and plains, while tigers are the ones in jungles.

Question: How many hearts does an octopus have?
Interesting Fact: Two hearts pump blood to the gills while the third heart pumps to the body.

Question: What is the highest-grossing film of all time?
Interesting Fact: Director James Cameron waited years for technology to advance before filming this epic movie.

Question: Which planet is known as the "Red Planet"?
Interesting Fact: Mars looks red because its surface is covered in rusty iron dust and rocks.

Question: What has a ring but no finger?
Interesting Fact: Old telephones used a physical bell to alert people of an incoming call.

Question: Who is the all-time leading scorer in NBA history?
Interesting Fact: LeBron James passed the long-standing scoring record during the twenty-twenty-three basketball season.

Question: Which food never spoils and can last for centuries?
Interesting Fact: Edible honey was found in ancient Egyptian tombs that are thousands of years old.

Question: What is the name of the wizard in the Harry Potter series?
Interesting Fact: The book series has been translated into over eighty different languages around the world.

Question: What force pulls objects toward the center of the Earth?
Interesting Fact: Gravity is the invisible force that keeps our feet on the ground every day.

Question: Which famous ship sank on its maiden voyage in 1912?
Interesting Fact: The Titanic was the largest ship afloat at the time it entered service in April.

Question: What animal is "Sonic" in the popular video games?
Interesting Fact: Sonic is famous for his incredible speed and his ability to collect gold rings.

Question: Which giant bird is a figure in many Indigenous legends?
Interesting Fact: The Thunderbird is said to create thunder by flapping its wings and lightning eyes.

Question: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
Interesting Fact: Diamonds are formed deep underground under intense heat and very high pressure over time.

Question: Which NFL quarterback has won the most Super Bowls?
Interesting Fact: Tom Brady won seven Super Bowl titles, more than any single NFL franchise has.

Question: What do you call a baby frog?
Interesting Fact: Tadpoles live underwater and breathe through gills before growing legs and turning into frogs.

Question: Which singer is known for her record-breaking "Eras Tour"?
Interesting Fact: This massive concert tour celebrates all the different musical stages of her successful career.

Question: What has an eye but cannot see?
Interesting Fact: The eye of a needle is the small hole where the thread passes through.

Question: How many continents are there on Earth?
Interesting Fact: The seven continents are Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Europe, North America, Oceania, and South America.
